definition[0]: to arrange for an agreement or official document to continue for a further period of time
example[0]: I need to renew my passport this year.
definition[1]: to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it
note[1]: renew a friendship/acquaintance etc (=become friendly with someone again)
example[1]: Local people have renewed their efforts to save the school.
example[2]: Police renewed their appeal for witnesses.
definition[2]: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
example[3]: The window frames need to be renewed.
definition[3]: to arrange for an existing contract, agreement, deal etc to continue
example[4]: Most airlinesrenew theirinsurance policies between July and October.
example[5]: The original contract had a term of three years, with an option to renew for two more.
definition[4]: to begin to do something again, after a period of time
example[6]: If oil prices remain high, U.S. industry will renew efforts to conserve energy.
example[7]: The company is renewing its focus on customer satisfaction.
